text: The 2002 West Asian Football Federation Championship took part in Syrian Capital of Damascus. Iraq won the final against Jordan 3–2 after extra time coming back from 0–2 at half time. The 6 entrants were Iraq, Iran, Jordan, Palestine, Lebanon and host nation Syria. The draw was held on 13 August in Kuala Lumpur. ==Venue== {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- |rowspan="5"| !colspan=3|Damascus |- | Abbasiyyin Stadium |- | Capacity: 30,000 |- | 150px |} ==Group stage== ===Group A=== \---- \---- ===Group B=== \---- \---- ==Knockout phase== ===Semi-finals=== \---- ===Third Place Match=== ===Final=== ==Statistics== ===Goalscorers=== ==External links== *RSSSF Page on the tournament Category:2002 in Asian football 2002 2002 Category:2002–03 in Syrian football Category:2002–03 in Jordanian football Category:2002–03 in Iranian football Category:2002–03 in Iraqi football Category:2002–03 in Lebanese football Category:2002 in Palestinian football
title: 2002 WAFF Championship
